page.title: 08LAYER WATER WORKS
page.content: These treatment works are owned by The Essex Water Company. The company operates five principal treatment works and a number of wells and bore holes to supply a potable water to the southern part of Essex. Layer and Langham Works can supply up to 200 Ml/day, approximately one third of the company's daily output. The main areas supplied are Witham, Chelmsford, Brentwood, Grays, Tilbury. Water is taken from the River Stour at Langham. It is pumped to a balancing reservoir at Ardleigh. From Ardleigh water gravitates the 8 miles to Abberton Reservoir. The Layer Works were built in 1939. Water flows from Abberton Reservoir into Layer Pits and then into preliminary settling Tanks. Water is filtered through sand and chlorine and ammonia are added. The treated water is pumped to Danbury.
